result.execSummary:
The defendant Cary M Lewandowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

No violent contact with victim listed in criminal complaint.
Defendant may travel to Illinois to take care of her Godson every weekend with approval of the Agent.
Anger Management and/or Domestic Violence Counseling to be determined by Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: received June 1, 2016, proposed order waiving DNA surcharge (not signed, request DENIED on 06-03-16 by Judge Ramirez)
Received June 1, 2016, from Atty Breanne Bucher, regarding waiving DNA surcharge (request DENIED on 06-03-16 by Judge Ramirez)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cary M Lewandowski in court with attorney Breanne Marie Bucher.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bucher makes statements.  Victim makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with victim listed in criminal complaint.
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Condition Time: 10 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant may travel to Illinois to take care of her Godson every weekend with approval of the agent.
Received on May 24, 2016, dated May 24, 2016 from Atty Breanne Bucher, with 4 character letters
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Bucher has received and reviewed discovery and requests additional time for negotiations.  The Court schedules the matter for plea and sentencing in about 60 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
